Lab 10: React Setup Documentation

Installation Steps:

To set up the React project, I first installed Node.js and npm. Using npm, I ran npx create-react-app my-react-app to scaffold the project. After navigating to the project folder, I ran npm start to launch the development server.

How I Built the Page:

I modified the default App.js to create this page. I learned that React components use JSX, which is a syntax extension that allows us to write HTML within JavaScript. I also used CSS to style the page to make it look more presentable.

Difficulties Encountered and Solutions:

One challenge I faced was understanding JSX and how JavaScript is embedded within HTML. I solved this by consulting the official React documentation and following online tutorials to get a better understanding. Another issue was handling errors during the initial setup—especially directory issues—which I fixed by making sure I navigated to the correct folders.

); } export default App;
